Mcspi_ConfigChfmt Struct Reference
MCSPI Driver API

Detailed Description

Structure to initialize the SPI transfer format register.

Field Documentation

UInt32 Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::busFreq

This is the bus frequency for this data format and maintained by the driver and is opaque to the user. This value must not be touched by the application!!

Int32 Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::charLength

Mcspi_WordLen - Defines word length of the data format, Legal values are b/w 4-32

Int32 Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::clockMode

Mcspi_ClkMode - The clock mode selection, depending on the polarity and the phase of the clock

UInt32 Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::clockRatioExtension

This option is used to concatenate with MCSPI_CHCONF[CLKD] register for clock ratio only when granularity is one clock cycle (MCSPI_CHCONF[CLKG] set to 1). Then the max value reached is 4096 clock divider ratio

Bool Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::granularityEnable

TRUE - Enable FALSE - Disable

Bool Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::multiWordAccessEnable

This option can only be used when a channel is enabled using a FIFO. It allows the system to perform multiple SPI word access for a single 32-bit OCP word access. This is possible for WL < 16. TRUE - Multiple word access enabled with FIFO. FLASE - Multiple word access disabled.

Int32 Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::slaveModeChipSelect

Mcspi_SpienSlv - This is used in the slave mode (channel 0 only), to select the proper master device

Bool Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::spiChipSelectEnablePol

Sets the polarity of the SPIEN signal, TRUE - POLARITY HIGH FALSE - POLARITY LOW

Int32 Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::spiDat0Dir

Mcspi_DatalineDirection - To configure the Dat0/Dat1 as the IN(Rx) or as OUT(Tx)

Int32 Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::spiDat1Dir

Mcspi_DatalineDirection - To configure the Dat0/Dat1 as the IN(Rx) or as OUT(Tx)

Bool Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::spienHighPolarity

Chip Select Polarity. Either active high/Low. Default it is set to Active Low = FALSE

Int32 Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::spiWordInitDelay

Mcspi_InitDelay - This configuration is used to hav the delay for the first spi word transfer to give time for system to complete parallel processes. This option is meaningful in master mode and single channel mode - Only 00 to 0x04 is valid.

Int32 Mcspi_ConfigChfmt::trasmitReceiveMode

Mcspi_DataTransferMode - The McSPI transmit receive mode(TRM), this holds good for both master as well as receive mode of operation
